SENT.plain: The immunosuppressant cyclosporine induces acute hemolysis (hemolytic uremic syndrome) in some patients after transplantation, possibly because of its effects on the vascular endothelium
We report a case of Coombs-negative, non-immune severe hemolytic anemia during cyclosporine therapy after allogeneic bone marrow transplantation for severe aplastic anemia
Vitamin E was effective in treating the intravascular hemolysis
